name: European Cabin Crew Association
goal: European Cabin Crew Association (EurECCA): is made up of cabin crew unions from ten European countries, representing over 70% of organized cabin crew in Europe,  promoting aviation safety  as well as better living and working conditions. The European Cabin Crew Association EurECCA is a European organisation based in Belgium at the heart of Europe. It is made up of cabin crew unions from European Union Member States as well as accession states and bordering states.
euInitiatives: EASA rule-making, CEN/TC 436 Cabin Air Quality on Commercial Aircraft- Chemical Agents, Aerotoxicity, Traffic Rights Agreements, Aviation Package, Aviation European strategy, Flight Time Limitations (FTL), Health and Safety, European for Fair Competition (E4FC), Social agenda for Europe's aviation, Protocols for dealing with contagious diseases on board, Health emergencies on board, Long-term impacts of working conditions on cabin crew's health, Cabin Safety procedures, Interoperability, Social dumping, Atypical forms of employment, Trans-national airlines: low cost & low fare airlines, The social challenges of mobile staff in aviation, Principal place of business, Temporary agency work, Self-employment, Posted workers, Home base, Ensuring fair competition inside and outside Europe, Ownership and control
